author: Stephanie Armour and Thomas M. Burton
title: Health-Agency Chiefs Defend Trump’s Plan to Lower Drug Prices
text:
Top federal health officials defended President Donald Trump’s plan to bring down drug prices Monday after Democrats said it left out more aggressive measures Mr. Trump advocated when he was a presidential candidate.
Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar, in remarks delivered in Washington, backed the president’s decision not to allow for the importation of American-made drugs from other countries such as Canada, a move Mr. Trump previously had suggested he favored.
